Die Position

Der moderne Produktionsbetrieb für Parenteralia in Kaiseraugst (PKau) ist verantwortlich für die Herstellung steriler Arzneimittel und beliefert den weltweiten Markt mit biopharmazeutischen Arzneimittelprodukten. An der Gefriertrocknungslinie (GEF) werden vorgefertigte Lösungen aseptisch abgefüllt und anschließend lyophilisiert. Die Linie verfügt über eigene Kapazitäten zum Auftauen/Einfrieren und für die Ansatzherstellung  (Compounding).


Die Möglichkeit

Als Mechaniker (m/w/d) bist du Bestandteil des Instandhaltungs-Teams innerhalb der Manufacturing Unit Sterile Filling und bist dem Technical Asset Care Lead unterstellt. In deiner Rolle arbeitest du eng mit den produzierenden Einheiten im Wertstrom und den lokalen Schnittstellen zusammen. Die Bereitschaft zu bereichsübergreifender Arbeit ist selbstverständlich. 


Die Stelle befindet sich in Kaiseraugst, und ist befristet auf 2 Jahre und in Vollzeit zu besetzen. Die Stelle beinhaltet Schichtarbeit (im 6/4-Schichtbetrieb; zweimal früh, zweimal spät, zweimal nachts, 4 Tage frei)


Folgende Aktivitäten gehören zu deinem Aufgabenbereich:

  • Du bist für die mechanische Verfügbarkeit der Prozessanlagen, inkl. Produktionsbetreuung, Störungsbehebung, Wartung und Problemlösung zuständig (First Level Support)

  • Erkennen, analysieren und fachgerechtes beheben von Störungen an hochautomatisierten Anlagen

  • Fachgerechte und selbständige Durchführung von geplanten Instandhaltungstätigkeiten sowie Formatwechsel an den Prozessanlagen

  • Sicheres Arbeiten im GMP-Umfeld, u.a. im Reinraum sowie GMP-gerechte Dokumentation der durchgeführten Instandhaltungstätigkeiten

  • Unterstützung der Schnittstellen, insbesondere des Betriebs- und Automation Engineerings inkl. Validierungs- und Qualifizierungstätigkeiten

  • Selbstständiges Erarbeiten und ausführen kleinerer Anlagenoptimierungen unter Einhaltung des „Change Management“ inkl. Schulen von Mitarbeitern im Umgang mit den Anlagen

  • Erhöhung der Anlagenverfügbarkeit durch Mitarbeit und Umsetzung von kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsmaßnahmen (KVP) wie z.B. Verwaltung von Ersatz- und Verschleissteilen oder Erstellen und optimieren von Wartungsplänen

Wer du bist:

  • Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung als Mechaniker (m/w/d)

  • Mind. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung, idealerweise in der pharmazeutischen Produktion (sterile Abfüllung) oder in einem stark regulierten Umfeld

  • Eine Weiterbildung zum Meister ist von Vorteil

  • Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch in Wort und Schrift

  • Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil

  • Kenntnisse im SAP-PM-Modul sowie im LPS (Lean Production System) sind von Vorteil

title: senior principal scientist , discovery oncology
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

In Roche´s Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development organisation (pRED), we make transformative medicines for patients in order to tackle some of the world’s toughest unmet healthcare needs. At pRED, we are united by our mission to transform science into medicine. Together, we create a culture defined by curiosity, responsibility and humility, where our talented people are empowered and inspired to bring forward extraordinary life-changing innovation at speed.

This position is located within our Discovery Research Units within the Oncology Discovery organization dedicated to the discovery and development of novel cancer therapeutics. We collaborate closely with functions in Therapeutic Modalities and Pharmaceutical Science, as well as within the oncology therapeutic area, to translate hypotheses into innovative therapeutics. 

The Opportunity

As a Senior Principal Scientist in Discovery Oncology, you'll drive cutting-edge cancer drug discovery programs through essential preclinical research. Your primary responsibilities include mentoring a team of scientists, associates, students, and postdocs, and translating basic research into therapeutic strategies.

You will focus on understanding target mechanisms, developing patient stratification methods, and identifying effective drug combinations for clinical application.

Furthermore, you will be crucial in the evaluation and due diligence of external innovation opportunities. A key task is designing and coordinating the preclinical in vivo pharmacology strategy for portfolio projects, ensuring close collaboration and alignment with the Translational Pharmacology Research Unit.

Additional key responsibilities: 

  • You lead target identification and exploratory activities, moving from initial ideation to program nomination, and proactively seek future horizon opportunities while passionately co-creating new areas of focus.

  • You lead high-impact, global, cross-functional portfolio projects, demonstrate resource awareness, and coordinate efforts as a matrix leader to meet long-term project objectives.

  • You drive key oncology discovery efforts from bench to insight. You design and execute sophisticated preclinical experiments, transforming complex, multi-omics data into actionable insights for target validation and understanding the mechanism-of-action (MoA) of therapeutic compounds. You regularly present and discuss your research strategies and findings to project teams, project leaders, and key stakeholders.

  • You are a scientific catalyst, driving the resolution of major challenges in your area of expertise. You contribute to scientific progress by providing expert, constructive feedback. Furthermore, you are responsible for proactively sourcing, integrating, and sharing new knowledge—both within your projects and across the entire portfolio—to accelerate learning and access throughout pRED.

  • You partner with the External Innovation lead, DLT, Discovery/early development teams, and TMo to coordinate the full cycle of external innovation. This encompasses everything from idea generation and prioritization to landscaping, opportunity evaluation, and due diligence execution.

  • You role model curiosity and flexibility in a matrix environment, proactively driving your own scientific and personal development. You actively enable learning within and across Discovery to advance the portfolio and innovation. You thrive in a dynamic, inclusive culture, helping to champion scientific excellence, accountability, urgency, partnerships, and continuous growth in technical skills and cancer biology expertise.

Who you are

  • You have a PhD or MD/PhD in Molecular or Cellular Biology, Immunology, Pharmacology (or a comparable biological science) with 6+ years of relevant postdoctoral experience in an academic or pharmaceutical/biotech environment. You have prior industry experience (preferred).

  • You have expertise in cancer-cell dependencies, as evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed journals and/or patents. You have experience in cancer drug discovery/translational research and targeting molecular pathways using diverse modalities, including small and/or large molecule compounds, protein-protein interaction disruption, induced proximity, and/or targeted conjugates.

  • You have experience in intracellular oncogenic signalling/cancer cell dependencies (required). You have extensive knowledge and understanding of other areas of cancer biology, including, but not limited to, cell cycle regulation, transcription factors, oncogenic signalling and immuno-oncology.

  • You have experience supporting IND study reports or contributing to relevant sections of IND study reports (considered an advantage). You have a proven record of evaluating and incorporating external innovation and working closely with colleagues in BD&L/partnering.

  • You have a collaborative mindset, experience and are eager to work within a matrix organization, focus on collective goal achievement, possess excellent communication skills, and are well-versed in key stakeholder interactions. You have people leadership experience, preferably in industry research and development settings.

Unwavering focus, collaborative teamwork and exceptional delivery are key behaviours that drive our mission of doing now what patients need next. Together, we can be transformative.

If you are passionate about contributing to a committed team and have the dedication to partnership and innovation, Roche is the place for you! 

Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference in patients’ lives. 

Apply now and join us in making an impact!

description:

Die Position

Orchestration and Exception Management (O&EM) is a new and fundamental capability for
Technical Operations (PT) in order to deliver a future portfolio of Cell & Gene Therapy products.
This portfolio of new products comes with the great promise to bring unprecedented medical advances to patients but also presents unique challenges: living products (e.g. cells) need to be delivered to patients in highly individualized supply chain models, which meet fast turn-around times at a zero-error quality level. Orchestration and Exceptions Management is one of three end-to-end value chain groups, responsible for the “virtual treatment journey” (data, transactions and documents). It is complementary to supply chain management that focuses on the “physical journey” (materials, specimens, product) and patient operations, responsible for the “patient journey”.

The Opportunity

The PTC (Pharma Technical Cell & Gene Therapies) ASPIRE Deployment Lead (DPL) supports the group wide ASPIRE program. He/she represents PTC’s interests as well as the program’s interests. In this role, the Deployment Lead is a member of the Wave Deployment Leadership team consisting of all DPLs, Capability Leads, wave SPOCs and more.  He/she enables successful business transformation by:

  • Connecting team members with the core team

  • Engaging people in the function across sites & Collaborating across sites to enable success

  • Standardizing business processes & systems

Key Responsibilities/Tasks

  • Regular visibility with and active engagement of the PTCS Leadership Team (LT) and Sponsor to secure their buy-in.

  • Leading, forming, and developing the PTC deployment team, which includes coordinating the nomination and onboarding of SMEs.

  • Aligning with other PTC Deployment Leads in parallel projects to manage shared resources, especially during critical stages.

  • Responsibility for reviewing and aligning on the global project plan, as well as coordinating detailed local execution, including budgeting, schedules, and resource planning.

  • Ownership of the local impact assessment and its execution, including evaluating the impact on downtime schedules and aligning with other sites.

  • Identifying and managing resistance and project risks, and coaching, motivating, and leading people through the change process.

  • Representing PTC in Capability Teams, such as Cutover, to ensure the successful execution of the go-live process.

Who you are

You have strong communication and presentation skills, allowing you to convey ideas clearly and persuasively. Your influencing skills are well-developed, enabling you to guide discussions and achieve desired outcomes. You can perform effectively under pressure, making sound decisions and expertly prioritizing tasks even in demanding situations. You are an organized self-starter, detail and results oriented, proven ability to meet milestones and hence able to work under pressure and balance priorities.

Furthermore, you bring the below qualifications and experience:

  • Educational background in Project Management, IT , Pharma, Cell & Gene Therapies,or similar, Master degree preferred

  • Project leadership experience in SAFE/Agile framework as well as a demonstrated delivery focus and execution, preferable in areas Intercompany, Marketing Plan to Cash and Demand to Pay

  • Experience with SAP on S/4 Hana, ideally in implementation projects  

  • Process transformation and large global transformation program experience is a benefit

  • Fluent English language skills both written & spoken

Du dienst sowohl unseren Patienten als auch unseren Mitarbeitern, indem Du Prozessverbesserungen entwickelst und implementierst und den Dialog und die Zusammenarbeit zwischen lokalen und globalen Funktionen in den Bereichen Entwicklung, Innovation und Regulatory förderst. title: O&EM Operations Functional Expert
description:

Die Position

Orchestration and Exception Management (O&EM) is a new and fundamental capability for
Technical Operations (PT) in order to deliver a future portfolio of Cell & Gene Therapy products.
This portfolio of new products comes with the great promise to bring unprecedented medical advances to patients but also presents unique challenges: living products (e.g. cells) need to be delivered to patients in highly individualized supply chain models, which meet fast turn-around times at a zero-error quality level. Orchestration and Exceptions Management is one of three end-to-end value chain groups, responsible for the “virtual treatment journey” (data, transactions and documents). It is complementary to supply chain management that focuses on the “physical journey” (materials, specimens, product) and patient operations, responsible for the “patient journey”.

The Opportunity

The O&EM Operations Functional Expert will support O&EM Operational activities which

include day to day orders, supply and distribution processes by ensuring timely execution of

business transactions, reliable system functionalities and compliant processing standards across the end-to-end value chain for the Cell & Gene Therapy. Responsibility to monitor the process, perform business transactions and provide issue resolution as well as support for system and/or interface related topics for the Cell & Gene Therapy Orchestration Platform along with SAP ERP. Moreover, you work closely with the broader PTC organization to document applicable operating standards, share best practice knowledge and provide training to employees on relevant procedures as well as contribute to the ERP transformation ASPIRE* (project work) for FHLR (short for F. Hoffmann - La Roche) which will deploy ASPIRE's digital backbone for the locations Basel & Kaiseraugst.

*ASPIRE is an enterprise-wide business transformation program that will harmonise all core end-to-end processes across the Roche enterprise and enable their execution from one standardised IT system template.

Key Responsibilities & Job Requirements

  • Actively participate in the local ASPIRE team, providing updates on workstream activities and managing stakeholder relationships.

  • Lead the organization of O&EM Operations System Readiness, including preparation, training, and SOPs.

  • Manage change activities, such as impact assessments, long lead-time item identification, and transition management.

  • Review processes and user requirements for O&EM Operations.

  • Analyze process and design impacts, identifying roadblocks and long lead items for ASPIRE.

  • Perform specific business transactions (e.g., sales orders, purchase orders) and monitor end-to-end value chain operations to ensure smooth execution and identify potential issues.

  • Ensure reliable virtual journey operations, providing business support and resolving system/interface issues in daily operations.

  • Train and support people on system procedures, share best practices, and maintain effective communication and collaboration across various functions.

  • Coordinate master data maintenance for Cell and Gene Therapy platforms and SAP ERP systems.

  • Participate in all project stages, including cutover, rehearsals, hypercare, and user acceptance testing (UAT).

Who you are

You are an organized self-starter who can flex and navigate a complex organization and deal with uncertainty. You lead without direct authority, using superior problem-solving, strong time and self-management, and excellent facilitation and presentation skills. You have a hands-on, solution-oriented approach and a proven ability to meet milestones, allowing you to perform under pressure and balance priorities. With outstanding collaboration, a strong sense of urgency, and a keen eye for detail, you translate complex problems into innovative solutions and drive decisions quickly within high-tech environments. You are an excellent communicator in English.

Furthermore, you bring the below qualifications and experience

  • Educational background in Project Management, IT , Pharma, Cell & Gene Therapies,or similar, Master degree preferred

  • Prior business experience (3+ years) in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, and/or
    consumer goods industries]

  • Comprehensive understanding of Supply Chain processes incl. customer Service & Order
    Management

  • In-depth knowledge of SAP systems ERP, and EDI interfaces, and willing & curious to learn & deeply grasp new platforms (CGT Platform)

  • Cross-functional project and operational experience in CGT operations (commercial & clinical), as well as understanding of ERP Implementation methodology, project management experience is a plus.

The Global Senior Clinical Operations Excellence Leader will be pivotal in driving portfolio-wide improvements and boosting clinical trial delivery productivity, ultimately impacting patient outcomes. This is an exciting chance to shape the operational models that underpin our mission.

title: principal devops engineer ml / ai algorithms
description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections,  where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Principal DevOps Engineer - ML/AI Algorithms

Developing software is great, but developing software with a purpose is even better! As a Principal DevOps Engineer - ML/AI Algorithms, you will work on products that help people with the most precious thing they have — their health. You will be part of the RIS Research & Development team contributing to digital health products touching Imaging, ML/AI, and computational science.

The Opportunity

As Principal DevOps Engineer, you will collaborate with important stakeholders on the development of the build, release, and deploy toolchain for DevOps, paving the way for seamless and efficient software delivery processes.

This role can be based in Santa Clara (primary location) or in secondary locations (Mississauga, Canada or Basel, Switzerland).

Key responsibilities:

  • Lead the initiative to set up, manage, and meticulously maintain parity across development, staging, and production application environments in cutting-edge cloud infrastructure, ensuring a robust and consistent deployment pipeline.

  • Champion the implementation of advanced monitoring infrastructure development, empowering the team with real-time insights and ensuring the highest levels of system reliability and performance.

  • Provide dedicated on-call support for production operations, ensuring the uninterrupted delivery of critical services and swift resolution of any operational issues.

  • Interface with software developers, product managers, test engineers and administrators on projects to design and develop the build, release, and deploy toolchain for DevOps while providing on-call support. 

  • Identify, troubleshoot and resolve issues quickly and effectively, sometimes under pressure. 

  • Actively involved in planning, high availability engineering, performance tuning, and automation/tools development. 

  • Manage multiple releases with focus on system reliability, scalability, and efficiency.

  • Implement and manage the full lifecycle of machine learning models, including versioning, deployment strategies (e.g., canary, A/B testing), monitoring for drift and performance, and decommissioning. 

  • Bring in leadership quality to improve technology and process of devops as well as provide mentorship to other devops engineers in the team.


Who You Are

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with a minimum of 8+ years of experience in a DevOps or equivalent combination of education and experience to perform at this level.

  • 8+ years of  experience with container technology, including Kubernetes, AWS EKS, Helm Charts, Splunk, and Docker, along with provisioning infrastructure through IAC using Terraform and cloud automation principles.

  • Proficiency in Unix/Linux administration in Shell scripting and internals with a preference for Ubuntu.

  • Deep working experience and extensive knowledge in building and deploying infrastructure using IaC frameworks such as terraform and AWS Cloudformation/SAM.

  • Experience building and automating scalable data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, distributed computing and versioning large-scale image datasets. 

  • Familiarity with DevOps practices and proficiency in log analysis and monitoring tools are essential for effective troubleshooting and system optimization.

  • Proficiency in Python for automating production systems, including Git, Gitlab, Git actions, GitHub CI/CD, familiarity with common ML libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn to understand the engineering needs of the ML models you will be deploying.

  • Strong working knowledge of AWS Cloud infrastructure, including EC2, S3, API Gateway, Kubernetics, RDS, VPC peering, Route53, S3, IAM, Batch, Lambda, AWS Config and Autoscaling.

Preferred:

  • MLOps experience with demonstrated experience supporting machine learning or computer vision teams.

  • Deep experience with container orchestration for ML workloads using Kubernetes, including frameworks like Kubeflow or KubeRay to manage distributed training jobs.

  • Familiarity with data versioning tools like DVC.

  • Familiarity with common ML libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn to understand the engineering needs of the ML models. 

  • Familiarity with other languages such as Java, R, and C/C++.

  • Experience with AWS services for machine learning, such as Amazon SageMaker, and experience managing GPU-accelerated compute instances (e.g., EC2 P and G series) for model training and inference.

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Santa Clara, CA is between $162,600 and $302,000.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance.  This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

Benefits

Relocation benefits are not available for this position.

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.


Let’s build a healthier future, together.

It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.

Die Position

At Roche, we believe it is urgent to deliver medical solutions right now, and we are passionate about transforming patients' lives. We are looking for a highly motivated research associate to join our team in Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED).

The Opportunity

As a Senior/Principal Research Associate, you will be an integral member of our Protein Interactions lab within the Neural Signalling Section, a dynamic research unit at the heart of the Neuroscience and Rare Disease (NRD) therapeutic area. The overarching goal of the Neural Signalling Section is to move forward drug discovery projects, from target assessment to early clinical phase, in the therapeutic area of neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease. You will collaborate closely with experts across various laboratories within NRD, as well as with teams from other departments in the collaborative drug discovery matrix of pRED, to translate research hypotheses into innovative therapeutics that address brain disorders:

  • Biochemistry of Protein Aggregation: Generate and characterize different aggregation states of proteins from recombinant proteins and human brain tissue homogenates using biochemical methods.

  • Cell Culture: Support the team with developing and characterizing Tau mutant cell lines, iPSC neurons, and brain organoids. You will also establish and validate various protein complementation, functional and seeding assays in cell culture.

  • Scientific Communication: Present your findings at internal project team and department meetings.

  • Collaboration & Leadership: Work closely with all group members, share lab organizational duties, and actively contribute to a positive and collaborative work atmosphere. You will also provide guidance and knowledge sharing to fellow research associates, scientists, and students.

Who You Are

We are looking for someone with a deep scientific curiosity and a drive for innovation. You work independently but also excel in a collaborative and inclusive team environment:

  • Required Qualifications: You have a bachelor's or master's degree in neuroscience, biology, biochemistry, life sciences, biomedicine, or a related field, with at least 5 years of laboratory experience or are holding a Biology Research Associate apprenticeship certificate or similar vocational training with several years of industry lab experience. Strong laboratory expertise in Tau biology or other intrinsically disordered proteins is required.

  • Preferred Experience: You bring extensive hands-on lab experience with protein interactions using biophysical, biochemical, and cell biological methods. Experience working with tissue processing, protein oligomerization and antibody characterization in in vitro and ex vivo systems is preferred.

  • Technical Skills: You excel in biochemical methods such as protein production (from E.coli, insect cells), purification (e.g.,FPLC, HPLC - HIC, SEC, IEC, IAC), Western blot, ELISA or related immunoassays. You also have expertise in working with various cell culture models, including primary neurons/iPSCs and techniques such as flow cytometry, immunocyto/histochemistry including establishing functional assays such as ROS, calcium & synapse analysis.Experience working with omics technology is a plus but not a must. 

  • Computational skills: Excellent data management and record keeping skills; Experience in Graphpad, spotfire, R, python programming is preferred.

  • Communication: You can communicate, write, and present fluently in English.

Die Position

Bei Roche sind wir davon überzeugt, dass es entscheidend ist, medizinische Lösungen sofort bereitzustellen – auch wenn wir Innovationen für die Zukunft entwickeln. Wir setzen uns mit Leidenschaft dafür ein, das Leben von Patient:innen zu verändern und sind mutig in unseren Entscheidungen und Taten. Wir sind der Meinung, dass gutes Handeln eine bessere Welt bedeuten. Deshalb kommen wir jeden Tag zur Arbeit. Wir verpflichten uns zu wissenschaftlicher Genauigkeit, unanfechtbarer Ethik und dem Zugang zu medizinischen Innovationen für alle. Wir tun dies heute, um ein besseres Morgen zu schaffen.

Die Organisation „Site Network Basel/Kaiseraugst”, die Teil der globalen Konzernfunktion „Corporate Strategy, Sustainability & Sites” ist, stellt die Infrastruktur für den gesamten Standort bereit und entwickelt diese kontinuierlich weiter. Wir arbeiten mit allen Stakeholder:innen entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette zusammen, von der frühen Forschung bis zur Patientenversorgung. Hier erwartet Dich  ein modernes Organisationsmodell, in dem Du deine Talente eigenverantwortlich in eine sinnvolle Tätigkeit einbringen kannst. Wir garantieren Raum für Kreativität und Entscheidungsfreiheit in unserer Organisation. Klassische Vorgesetzte findest Du bei uns nicht.

Die Möglichkeit

Als Digital Operations Manager im Kreis Digital Infrastructure and Services (DIS) bei Roche spielst du eine zentrale Rolle bei der Steigerung unserer betrieblichen Effizienz durch IoT-Lösungen an unserem Standort Basel/Kaiseraugst. Du stellst sicher, dass unsere digitale Infrastruktur datenbasierte  Entscheidungen unterstützt und trägst so direkt zu den Zielen von Roche in der pharmazeutischen Wertschöpfungskette bei. Deine Aufgaben umfassen die Identifizierung von betrieblichen Anforderungen, von der Edge bis zur Plattform, sowie die Unterstützung, Verbesserung und Ausführung der End-to-End-Betriebsprozesse unserer IoT-Lösungen. Dies beinhaltet auch das Monitoring der täglichen Performance  unserer digitalen Systeme. Dadurch trägst du dazu bei, die Betriebsabläufe von Roche zu optimieren, die Servicebereitstellung zu verbessern und unsere führende Rolle bei technologischen Innovationen in der Pharmaindustrie zu behaupten.

Hauptverantwortlichkeiten:

  • In Zusammenarbeit mit dem Team verwaltest du den täglichen Betrieb der IoT-Systemlandschaft und stellst deren Stabilität, Effizienz und Skalierbarkeit sicher. Dazu gehören die Überwachung der Systemleistung, die Fehlerbehebung und die Umsetzung von Verbesserungen, um den sich ändernden Anforderungen des Unternehmens gerecht zu werden.

  • Durch die Integration neuer Geräte und Dienste in die IoT-Plattform, in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Entwickler:innen, Betreiber:innen und Ingenieur:innen, skalierst du unsere Lösungen. Deine Rolle ist entscheidend, um eine nahtlose Konnektivität und einen reibungslosen Datenfluss zwischen Edge-Geräten, der Plattform und den Endanwendungen zu gewährleisten.

  • Du arbeitest mit internen Stakeholder:innen zusammen, um Anforderungen und Feedback zu sammeln und diese in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für die kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Plattform zu übersetzen. Deine Fähigkeit zur effektiven Kommunikation wird die Brücke zwischen den technischen und geschäftlichen Bereichen schlagen und die IoT-Abläufe mit den Unternehmenszielen in Einklang bringen.

  • Zudem dokumentierst du Systemkonfigurationen, Verfahren und Best Practices und sorgst so für eine reibungslose Übergabe von Projekten in den Betrieb. Diese Arbeit unterstützt den Wissensaustausch innerhalb des Teams und im gesamten Unternehmen und verbessert unser kollektives Verständnis und die effiziente Nutzung der IoT-Systemlandschaft.

  • Du förderst agile Methoden und eine Kultur der schnellen Iteration, des Feedbacks und des kontinuierlichen Lernens.

Wer Du bist

  • Du hast nachweislich Erfahrung im operativen Management, insbesondere im Bereich von IoT-Plattformen oder der ICT.

  • Ein Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Informationstechnologie, Ingenieurwesen oder einem verwandten Bereich ist von Vorteil. Postgraduale Qualifikationen in Bereichen, die speziell mit IoT oder digitalem Infrastrukturmanagement zu tun haben, sind von grossem Nutzen.

  • Du hast eine nachgewiesene Erfolgsbilanz bei der erfolgreichen Bereitstellung und dem Betrieb  von Plattformen, idealerweise mit umfassendem Verständnis von IoT-Geräten, Netzwerkprotokollen, Cloud-Diensten und Programmiersprachen wie JavaScript und SQL.

  • Kenntnisse in Datenmanagement-Konzepten, Datenorchestrierung und API-Management sind ein grosses Plus.

  • Ein solides Fundament in agilen Arbeitsmethoden sowie deine Fähigkeit, in dynamischen technologischen Umgebungen zu führen und dich anzupassen, sind von grossem Vorteil.

  • Eine proaktive Herangehensweise, eine kooperative Einstellung und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten werden dir helfen, in unserem modernen Organisationsmodell erfolgreich zu sein.

  • Du besitzt gute Englischkenntnisse für eine reibungslose Kommunikation (C1)

Werde jetzt Teil von Roche, setze dein technisches Know-how ein und gestalte den Bereich 'Digital Infrastructure and Services' am Standort Basel mit.

Roche Diagnostic Solutions is responsible for delivering on our Diagnostics Strategy. Within this, the Core Lab business area plays a key role: we strive to expand global access to innovative diagnostics and empower our customers to improve patient outcomes across the healthcare continuum.

We are CMC experts and build our strength on a broad diversity of technical expertise in chemistry, formulation design, material science and analytical chemistry, delivering and innovating in the space of small molecules, peptides and nucleic acid-based medicines.


The opportunity
We are offering a unique opportunity to join our team in the Roche Innovation Center Basel as a Senior/Principal Associate in the Pharmaceutical Material Sciences team. In this role you will be applying your skills to the scientific and analytical foundations for rational solid form selection and milling of drug candidates. Your contributions will be instrumental in advancing our portfolio by successfully transforming molecules into medicines.

Therefore we are looking for a creative hands-on expert who will take ownership of planning and executing optimal milling processes for each project at various scales approaching technical and scientific challenges with enthusiasm and a problem-solving mindset.

Additionally you will have the chance to further our contributions to material sciences through state of the art solid state analytical technologies.

Your main tasks and responsibilities will include: 

  • As a partner to project teams, you will independently plan and perform optimal milling processes to support the formulation development of diverse projects. 

  • You assume full ownership of the milling facilities, including day-to-day upkeep, troubleshooting and minor maintenance, and coordinating complex repairs with dedicated internal or external specialists.

  • You will evaluate, optimize, and implement new technologies in the field to enhance efficiency and product quality.

  • You will maintain a detailed and accurate record of all experimental work, and author comprehensive technical reports, summaries, and presentations.

  • You will work effectively within a cross-functional environment, fostering clear communication with interfaces and project teams to ensure seamless project progression.

  • As a specialist in solid form analytics, your focus will be performing XRPD (X-ray Powder Diffraction) analyses to ensure a thorough understanding of solid forms across different projects and stages of development.

  • You hold a successful apprenticeship, Bachelor’s degree or higher in Material Sciences, Pharmaceutical Technology, Solid State Chemistry, or a related field.

  • You have proven experience in the context of milling pharmaceutically relevant materials or you bring proven experience in characterizing solid form or powder properties with a strong drive to become a milling expert.

  • Experience in solid form analytics - especially XRPD or pharmaceutical solid form screening is beneficial.

  • You demonstrate a high level of technical understanding and ideally have experience in automation.

  • You exhibit meticulous laboratory hygiene and show strong safety awareness while experience in handling highly active substances is a plus. 

  • A proactive, results-driven mindset combined with excellent problem-solving skills is essential. 

  • You demonstrate the ability to operate in self-organized teams with flat hierarchy and collaborate inclusively across departments and global functions.

title: Senior/ Principal Associate Scientist
description:
Bei Roche kannst du ganz du selbst sein und wirst für deine einzigartigen Qualitäten geschätzt. Unsere Kultur fördert persönlichen Ausdruck, offenen Dialog und echte Verbindungen. Hier wirst du für das, was du bist, wertgeschätzt, akzeptiert und respektiert. Dies schafft ein Umfeld, in dem du sowohl persönlich als auch beruflich wachsen kannst. Gemeinsam wollen wir Krankheiten vorbeugen, stoppen und heilen und sicherstellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und in Zukunft. Werde Teil von Roche, wo jede Stimme zählt.

Die Position

Pharma Technical Development Europe Biologics brings game-changing therapies from clinical phase I into the market to serve every patient, every day.  Our core business is to develop safe, innovative and effective drugs using cutting edge technologies for manufacturing process (Drug Substance and Drug Product), clinical supply, formulation, device, packaging, and analytical development. Our daily work also includes compiling of regulatory documents and the transfer of development projects to commercial manufacturing. We are striving for a caring and sensing network organization, which lives a culture of trust and collaboration. Our smart people drive innovation through their expertise, passion and "getting it done" mentality. The benefit for the patient is in the center of our thoughts and efforts. The department 'Analytical Development and Quality Control Biotech Europe' is responsible for Biochemical Analytical Development, Quality Control and Compliance required for Analytics of Biopharmaceuticals from pre IND (= Investigational New Drug) to BLA (Biologics License Application) and Launch.

The Opportunity:

  • Analysis of drug product formulations under GMP conditions (HPLC, compendial methods)

  • Coordination of analytical activities, including sample management for biotechnological development products

  • Support of development, improvement and validation of analytical methods for the quality assessment of active substances and galenical forms

  • Evaluation of new technologies/methods and support of innovation projects

  • Planning and monitoring of the work packages to ensure efficient analytics and continuous improvement

  • Maintaining efficient and timely GxP-conform analytics and documentation following the current GxP guidelines as well as the relevant SOPs

  • Authoring of GMP documents, e.g. analytical procedures, validation reports, change control documents

Who you are:

  • Lab technician with at least 1-3 years experience in the pharmaceutical industry with a strong focus on analytics, preferable in a GMP environment

  • Vocational scientific qualification (e.g. apprenticeship) or Bachelors degree in analytics, biochemistry, biotechnology or related fields or is required

  • Hands-on experience in HPLC & excipients (e.g. Polysorbates & Poloxamers) analytics is preferred

  • Self-motivated, proactive, responsible, result-oriented and an excellent team player

  • Preparedness to apply novel software tools to increase efficiency in data handling is mandatory

  • Good written and spoken English and German is a must

Roche is an equal opportunity employer. If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organisation for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now!

Wer wir sind

Eine gesündere Zukunft treibt uns zur Innovation an. Mehr als 100.000 Mitarbeiter weltweit arbeiten gemeinsam daran, wissenschaftliche Fortschritte zu erzielen und sicherzustellen, dass jeder Zugang zur Gesundheitsversorgung hat – heute und für zukünftige Generationen. Durch unser Engagement werden über 26 Millionen Menschen mit unseren Medikamenten behandelt und mehr als 30 Milliarden Tests mit unseren Diagnostik-Produkten durchgeführt. Wir ermutigen uns gegenseitig, neue Möglichkeiten zu erkunden, Kreativität zu fördern und hohe Ziele zu setzen, um lebensverändernde Gesundheitslösungen zu liefern. 

Gemeinsam können wir eine gesündere Zukunft gestalten.

Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, der die Chancengleichheit fördert.
